result.execSummary:
The defendant Jayton J Richmond was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Robbery with Use of Force, a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Preliminary hearing on March 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.

CASH BOND SHALL REVERT TO A SIGNATURE BOND IF CO-SIGNED BY STEPMOTHER ROCHEL JOHNSON
- Defendant shall not have any contact, direct or indirect, with Stephon J.
- Defendant shall be within their residence between the hours of 7 p.m. and 6 a.m. unless at, or traveling to or from, school, treatment, or employment as approved by BMP in writing.
- The Court finds that cash bond is necessary to assure the defendant's appearance in Court. Cash bond is set in the amount of $5000.00 per case. If the defendant posts cash bail or stepmother co-signs, the defendant must report to and comply with DCBM as a condition of the defendant's release. The defendant shall report to DCBM by 10:00 A.M. on the business day following his/her release from jail.   If the defendant fails to comply with DCBM, a body only bench warrant shall be issued for the defendant's arrest and the defendant shall be held in custody until bail is reviewed by the court.
Defendant did not waive the time limits for Preliminary Hearing.
Trial judge - Br 12

Defendant in court with Attorney  State Public Defender.  Andrea B. Raymond appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The defendant received a copy of the Complaint and waived reading.  Defendant stood mute.  Court entered not guilty plea as to any misdemeanor counts.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 18, 2014 at 02:30 pm.
